intro: Hemicarpus, commonly known as the water hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is characterized by its aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat, typically found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. The plants have showy, often pink or red, flowers that bloom during the summer months. Their leaves are usually heart-shaped and can vary in size depending on the species. Hemicarpus species are known for their ability to thrive in moist environments and are often used in ornamental gardening.
